alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 3:19AM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY FOR MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow with total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches above 7000 feet near and west of US-395, and 1 to 2 feet near the Sierra crest. Below 7000 feet, 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, with gusts to 60 mph along the Sierra crest in the morning. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times. The hazardous conditions could impact daily commutes through this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main period of snow is expected through this afternoon. This evening, lighter snow will continue mainly near the Sierra crest. Road conditions will vary from wet to slushy and snow covered with the worst conditions over passes along Highway 395. Check with Caltrans for the latest road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
